channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3619] Pirated DVD vs. Legal DVD
item.description: Vote with your wallet...and your hard drive.

item.title: [+2122] Mike Rowe posts about Captain Phil
item.description: Me: Hey Phil, how’s it going?Phil: Mike, I got nothing to say to you until you ride my bike.Me: Beg your pardon?Phil: I said that you and I have nothing to talk about until you ride my bike. Got it?With that, Phil walked me out to his bike, tossed me his keys, crossed his arms, and waited for me to ride off. And so I did.

item.title: [+2013] School used student laptop webcams to spy on them
item.description: Spying on kids at home! The laptops issued to high-school students in the well-heeled Philly suburb have webcams that can be covertly activated by the schools' administrators

item.title: [+1487] Woman, 61, arrested for asking "Why?"
item.description: Atlanta's Citizen Review Board found that Officer Brandy Dolson had falsely arrested Minnie Carey, then 61, after she questioned why he had told her to move along on a sidewalk.

item.title: [+1396] 'Your bad ass new roommate' (PIC)
item.description: Now THAT'S how to advertise a room for rent.

item.title: [+1289] A Programmer's Business Card [PIC]
[+1174] Zero Punctuation - Mass Effect 2
item.description: This week, Zero Punctuation reviews Mass Effect 2.

item.title: [+1163] Hey, who let the Tron guy on the ice‽ [Pic]
[+1117] RHIC Collider Creates Quark-Gluon Plasma at 4,000,000,000,00
item.description: Hottest matter ever created in a lab; may have induced law-of-nature-warping bubble

item.title: [+1058] Things You Should Boycott: Assassin's Creed II and Its DRM
item.description: We love Assassin’s Creed II. It’s a fantastic game that actually lives up to all the promise its predecessor fell just short of. Its DRM, however, manages to undo all that good will and then some.

item.title: [+1008] Brits are boob obsessed
item.description: MILLIONS of people ogle boobs up to seven times a day — and that's just other women we're talking about.

item.title: [+878] BREAKING - Small Plane Crashes into Austin Office Building
item.description: Austin police say a plane has crashed into a building in the 9400 block or Research Boulevard.Austin-Travis County EMS Assistant Director James Shamard said smoke is visible for at least a mile and that paramedics have set up a triage center at the scene. “We have no idea right now if there are any patients, or how many.”

item.title: [+842] Man arrested for using Olympic Torch to light up
item.description: A guy... most likely not Jesus, tries to fire one up using the Olympic Flame and gets arrested. He should get the Gold for ballsy moves.

item.title: [+701] Obama's college friend - he was a "pure Marxist socialist."
item.description: A college friend of President Obama calls him a 'pure Marxist socialist' who 'definitely saw America as the enemy.'

item.title: [+697] Why did Obama Flip on Gay Marriage?
item.description: President Obama says he opposes same-sex marriage for religious reasons. Fourteen years ago, however, while a churchgoing Christian and a state legislative candidate, he endorsed the right of gays and lesbians to marry...Human do mistake...

item.title: [+689] Nation Realizes Money Is Just A Symbolic Shared Illusion
item.description: WASHINGTON - "I've spent the last 24 years in this room yelling 'Buy, buy! Sell, sell!' but what have I actually accomplished? All I've done is move arbitrary designations of wealth from one column to another," said longtime stock trader Michael Palermo.

item.title: [+639] Minimalist Star Wars Tourism Posters [PICS]
item.description: Justin Van Genderen is a graphic designer in Chicago. He made these minimalist travel posters for the locations in Star Wars. The posters are quite beautiful and are reminiscent of classic travel posters from decades past.

item.title: [+619] Google Goggles to Translate Text in Photos
item.description: At the Mobile World Congress, Google CEO Eric Schmidt showed off a new prototype of Google Goggles — Google’s experimental Android visual search application — that can translate text captured in photos.

item.title: [+569] Movie Theaters Threaten To Ban Alice In Wonderland
item.description: In a bid to improve their DVD and Blu-ray sales, Disney is pushing to pull Alice In Wonderland from theaters less than 90 days after its March 5th release date. This shortening is bad news for theater owners, as theaters run the risk of losing important discount business to people who decide to wait for home video.

item.title: [+568] Star Wars Never Looked So Real (PICS)
item.description: The project shows how Star Wars would look if it took place on the earth instead of the space. The shooting of the photos happened in Dubai.
